channel.title: Command Help
channel.description:
I was trying to addopt this code from the Rep System in the tutorial list, but, didnt go so well. So, now I ask... How can I make a command that will write a line to a text document?
Like, if I type ::rep Test1 My account is test 2, I would need it to write "test 2 added reputation test 1"
I just really need a template for this. Anyone help?

item.title: Command Help
item.dc:creator: @Blood_Argon Blood_Argon
item.description:
@Blood_Argon wrote:

I need basically this…

[code] }
BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     String name = command.substring(4); 
 client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; 
 bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/warnlogs.txt", true));
 bw.write("[---"+name+" reported by "+playerName+"---]");
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();

}
[/code]
But I have a feeling its not how its suppose to go, whenever I add it in, it bugs the next command with “else without if”
I put it after the command, and I give the command a string name so that this can read from it, and write it out. But, like I said, giving me errors for the next command X_X[br][size=1]Posted at: November 17, 2006, 05:52:15 PM[/size][hr]<>[br][size=1]Posted at: November 17, 2006, 06:15:34 PM[/size][hr]<>

Read full topic
